ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timestamp for the end of the session/task
Did you have difficulty seeing the task?
5. ... you felt very bored?
If you felt bored, describe when exactly?
Were you tired during the task?
If you felt tired during the task, describe when exactly?
Did you fall asleep during the task?
If you fell asleep during the task, describe when exactly?
Were the sleep item instructions clear during the task?
Do you have any comments about the clarity of instruction during the task?
Were you ever confused about what to do during the task ?
Do you have any comments about the confusion with the task?
Did you ever feel surprised at what came next during the task?
Do you have any comments about what surprised you during the task?
How well do you think you did with the task completion during the task?
Is there any reason why you were moving during the task? (uncomfortable, itch, etc)
